subject: Certain lenders in New Zealand are said to reduce mortgage rates to below 4.00%
US House Democrats are to probe US President Trump for targeting CNN and Washington Post
Around USD 57.8bln of deals were agreed to at China's International Import Expo , according to local press
PRE-MARKET JAPANESE AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: Japan’s government is said to mull a JPY 10tln stimulus to offset next year’s planned sales tax hike
content:
JAPAN

Chiyoda (6366 JT)
- Co. forecasts FY net loss JPY 105bln due to delayed US LNG facility and said it was discussing financial support with leading shareholder Mitsubishi Corp. (Nikkei)

Coca-Cola Bottlers Japan (2579 JT)
- Co. 9-month net JPY 13.9bln vs. Prev. JPY 23.8bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Mitsui Fudosan (8801 JT)
- Co. H1 net JPY 68.6bln vs. Prev. JPY 48.6bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Resona Holdings (8308 JT)
- Co. H1 net JPY 122.1bln vs. Prev. JPY 94.1bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Tokyu (9005 JT)
- Co. H1 net JPY 33.3bln vs. Prev. JPY 36.9bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Other News
- Japan’s government is said to mull a JPY 10tln stimulus to offset next year’s planned sales tax hike. (Newswires)


SOUTH KOREA

Celltrion (068270 KS)
- Co. Q3 net KRW 56.2bln vs. Exp. KRW 100bln. (Newswires)

Other News
- South Korea Finance Minister Hong said GDP is likely to be below 2.9%. (Newswires)

subject: US Treasury Department extends deadline again for Rusal (486 HK) customers to wind down their contracts and business with the Co.
Oil prices reopen higher by 1% with WTI crude futures back above USD 60/bbl after Saudi announced to reduce exports by 500k bpd in December
Alibaba (BABA) Singles Day sales at a record CNY 213.5bln
PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIAN STOCK NEWS: WTI fell for a 10th consecutive session on Friday
content:
ANZ Bank (ANZ AT)
- The lender is planning changes to its assessment on mortgage applications which is to include deep-dive analyses on applicant income and credit checks. (AFR)

Elders (ELD AT)
- Co. FY18 net AUD 71.6mln vs. Prev. AUD 57.7mln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Healthscope (HSO AT)
- Co. Chairman Dwyer is thought to be against the offer from BGH consortium. (The Australian)
- Co. announced proposal from Brookefield valued at AUD 2.585/Shr. (Newswires)

Link Administration Holdings (LNK AT)
- Shareholders of over 82% of PEXA Capital have approved the Link consortium offer. (Newswires)

QBE Insurance (QBE AT)
- Co. guides its net investment return to be at the bottom end of target range. (Newswires)

Rio Tinto (RIO AT)
- Co. completed off-market share buyback valued at AUD 2.87bln. (Newswires)
- Co. also completed deal related to lease and sale of land at Kitimat to LBNG Canada.

Scentre Group (SCG AT)
- Co. is mulling transferring some mall assets to a separate fund valued at AUD 1.0bln. (AFR)

Seven Group (SVW AT)
- Co. guides FY19 underlying EBIT at AUD 621mln. (Newswires)

Woolworths (WOW AT)
- Co. unit ALH Group is reportedly next on its sale list. (The Australian)

Energy
- WTI crude fell for a 10th consecutive session on Friday in which futures declined below USD 60/bbl. (Newswires)
- However, Saudi Arabia Energy Minister Al-Falih stated that Saudi will reduce oil supply by 500k bpd in December amid seasonal decline in demand. (Newswires)

subject: Veritas and Elliot are said to be nearing a deal to acquire AthenaHealth (ATHN)
South Korea Finance Minister Hong says GDP is likely to be below 2.9%
China CBIRC is mulling requiring banks to allocate 50% of new loans to the private sector in 3 years
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include Japanese PPI and Machine Tool Orders, Singapore Retail Sales
ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

PBoC said the Chinese economy is under increasing downward pressure, while it also commented that trade frictions with the US brings uncertainty to future exports and could intensify financial market volatility. (Newswires)

US Secretary of State Pompeo said US is seeking friendly and constructive dialogue with China, while there were also comments from a Chinese Official that China has committed itself to working with the US in a non-confrontational way and that economic teams will seek mutually acceptable solution on trade. (Newswires)

New Zealand Electronic Card Retail Sales (Oct) M/M 0.1% (Prev. 1.1%). (Newswires)
New Zealand Electronic Card Retail Sales (Oct) Y/Y 6.2% (Prev. 5.7%)
 

UK

UK PM May was forced to drop her plan for an emergency cabinet meeting on Monday to approve a Brexit deal as she faced strong opposition from both her cabinet and the EU, which lessens the likelihood for an EU summit taking place later this month. (Independent) As a reminder, Brexit negotiators said on Friday that a draft treaty is close and that both sides were aiming for political approval next week, while separate reports noted that the EU is to require more movement from the UK on Brexit backstop. (FT/Newswires)

UK Trade Secretary Fox said a contentious number of issues remain for a Brexit deal to be reached and that UK may not be able to reach a deal on its departure from the EU. (Newswires)

Former UK Foreign Minister Boris Johnson accused the UK government of being on the brink of total surrender in Brexit negotiations, while he stated UK PM May recommended staying in the EU customs union under backstop and abdicating power to leave the backstop. (Telegraph)

UK GDP Prelim QQ Q3 0.6% vs. Exp. 0.6% (Prev. 0.4%). (Newswires)
UK GDP Prelim YY Q3 1.5% vs. Exp. 1.5% (Prev. 1.2%)


COMMODITIES

Saudi Arabia Energy Minister Al-Falih said it is too premature for OPEC to discuss production cuts but stated that Saudi will reduce oil supply by 500k bpd in December amid seasonal decline in demand, while Russian Energy Minister Novak said December output is forecast at around the November level. (Newswires)

OPEC+ technical monitoring panel puts October oil cut compliance at 104% vs. 111% in September. (Newswires)

Iraq is close to a deal to restart oil exports from Kirkuk which could add up to 400k BPD in an attempt to stop prices rising from Iran's fall in exports. (FT)


GEOPOLITICAL

Saudi Intelligence officials close to the Crown Prince reportedly asked private contractors about assassinating Iranian enemies, according to sources. (NYT)
 

US

US President Trump was reportedly telling people he wants to replace Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross by the end of the year. (CNBC)

US House Democrats are to probe US President Trump’s role regarding hush payments in 2016, while there were also reports that Federal prosecutors have gathered evidence that US President Trump participated in hush money payments to Stormy Daniels and Karen McDougal which would violate campaign laws. (WSJ)

MARKET RECAP

Walt Disney (DIS) was a top mover today after it beat EPS and revenue estimates. Campbell Soup (CPB) traded higher following investment firm Third Point urging shareholders to vote in favour of its trimmed list of board nominees. Several consumer staples outperformed today such as Colgate-Palmolive (CL), Coty (COTY) and Kimberley-Clark (KMB). Activision Blizzard (ATVI) nosedived after missing EPS and revenue estimates and significantly cutting its EPS guidance. Century Link (CTL) also dipped lower after poor earnings. General Electric (GE) was a bottom mover on the back of JPMorgan lowering its price target, citing dismal earnings. A drop in copper prices lead to a fall in the miner Freeport-McMoRan (FXC). Trade-sensitive stocks, such as Boeing (BA) and Caterpillar (CAT), traded lower after negative economic data from China. SPX -0.9% at 2781, NDX -1.7% at 7039, DJI -0.7% at 25989.

Although the Fed’s statement on Thursday was largely considered hawkish, Treasuries resumed its role as a haven amid the stock slide and renewed concerns around the Chinese economy (PBOC sees downward pressures on China growth, in its Q3 monpol implementation report, which brought out buyers in Tsys), with yields coming in by between c.3-4bps by settlement; major curve spreads were generally biased towards flattening (of up to around 1.5bps) though the 5s30s and 10s30s part of the curve was modestly wider. US T-note futures (Z8) settled 11 ticks higher at 118-04.
